A Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is a type of . A Component_to_physical_usage_view_assignment is the association between one
and another , where one is in the

ext_description.note: The main use of this concept is to support the identification of the connector in an assembly design view that is related to a connector in a usage view for that assembly. In many cases the reference designator for the usage view is different than that of the design view, and the full details of the connector in the usage view may not be provided. In many cases, the product is not the same product as well, if there are multiple levels of assembly between the design view at which the connector is installed and the product at which the connector is made visible for interface purposes.
ext_description.example: A connector in a PCA assembly may be J1 in that assembly. The unit in which the PCA is a low level subassembly (with a partial reference designation itself of A1A3A4) may have an access hole in the cover which makes the connector directly visible and may have identification of that connector at the product level of J12. In this case the design organization would know that A1A3A4J1 was represented at the unit level as J12.

ext_description.p:
A Part_design_view is a type of
and a type of . A Part_design_view shall describe an item in sufficient detail to permit production of that item in a manufacturing process or analysis of that item's response to a simulated environment in a computer based experimental environment. The case of analysis is supported by predefined analysis input and output shape models in addition to the design shape model. Multiple shape models may reference the same Part_design_view. When multiple shape models reference the same Part_design_view, the individual shape models have different purposes in the design process. Multiple shape models may reference one Part_design_view when it is desired to have one set of features to be included in the view. For each part level shape model there would be a separate shape model for the feature in the context of that part level shape model, but the identification of the feature and the relationship of the feature to the Part_design_view is invariant. The version attribute inherited from
need not reference the same product version referenced by the
that this view references in the role of usage_view.
ext_description.note: In electrical and electronic design processes, it is common practice to analyse the design information provided to manufacturing in addition to idealizations of the design created for analysis purposes.

An Assembly_component is a type of
and a type of . An Assembly_component is the occurrence of a or in an assembly or in an interconnect. An Assembly_component may include additional product data over that defined in or . An Assembly_component that is no other type is intended to be an instance of a and not of a . Requirements and parameters may be assigned directly to an Assembly_component in which case the interpretation shall be that the assignment is valid for all design views related to the Assembly_component. Requirements and parameters may be assigned through a member of in which case the interpretation shall be that the assignment is valid for only that design view.

example.p: Figure 1 illustrates a detail of an assembly drawing that shows the Assembly_component in relation to a cross-sectional view of the . Figure 2 illustrates a complete assembly showing multiple Assembly_component.

ext_description.note: An Assembly_component may be assembled onto an in the realization of an . An Assembly_component may be an occurrence of an . An Assembly_component may be an occurrence of an . For the purposes of this model, the current interpretation is to treat an embedded discrete component as a . The that mates with the of the embedded component is not visible when the is assembled, but the is still logically the interface to the for the embedded component.

A discrete component that is installed or embedded during part of the sequential manufacturing process for the is considered to be an Assembly_component since the form of the component is not realized during the sequential manufacturing process.
A occurrence is not permitted in an assembly definition.

An Assembly_component may be a floor-planning symbol if the definition is an or an . If the Assembly_component is used in this manner, then the actual components will be included in the design in a later iteration that results from including the detailed components from the or using a computer processor. ext_description.p: A Thermal_component is a type of that is included in the design in order to satisfy a heat flow requirement.
ext_description.note: An utilized as a Thermal_component may be another type of as well.
ext_description.example: Examples of Thermal_component are: a heatsink, thermal grease, a thermal via, an active thermal cooler (such as a fan), or a thermoelectric cooler.
